participant_1.name: Emily
participant_1.personality: Empathetic and nurturing, she has a calming presence and is always willing to lend an ear.
participant_1.background: I have trained over 20 types of animals. My daughter just graduated high school ranked at the top of her class. I am a zookeeper. I work with my wife. My wife is a breast cancer survivor.

participant_2.name: Michael
participant_2.personality: Reflective and somewhat reserved, he tends to process emotions internally but is open to discussing his feelings when prompted.
participant_2.background: My wife just left me. My favorite city is New York. I love to run. I am a lawyer.

content.text: Hi! How are you doing today?
Not so great. I just found out my wife is leaving me.
Oh, no! I'm so sorry to hear that.
Thanks. It's been a rough day.
I can imagine. Do you want to talk about it?
I don't know. I'm not sure what to say.
Well, you can start by telling me how you feel.
I'm just feeling really lost and alone. Like I don't know what to do or where to go.
I can understand that. It's a lot to take in.
It is. I just don't understand why she's doing this.
There could be a lot of reasons. It's not necessarily anything you did wrong.
I don't know. I feel like I must have done something wrong.
You don't know that for sure. Maybe she just needs some time to figure things out.
I hope so. I just don't know what to do right now.
Well, you don't have to do anything right now. You just need to take some time to process everything.
I guess you're right. I just wish I knew what the future held.
I don't know either. But I can tell you that you're not alone. There are a lot of people who have been through this and come out stronger.
Of course. I'm here for you if you need anything.
